doc.headline: ESPN's racial slur in Jeremy Lin story
doc.post: You have got to be fuccking kidding me with this. http://sports.yahoo.com/blogs/nba-ball-dont-lie/whether-intentional-not-espn-since-deleted-headline-jeremy-192208429.html Whether intentional or not, ESPNâ€™s since-deleted headline about Jeremy Lin was distressing And Yahoo isn't letting me copy the text for some reason... basically some WTFucckery going on with a very evident racial slur being used in an ESPN headline.

Even using that phrase appropriately, I feel uncomfortable and weird, so I don't say it. In A Midsummer Night's Dream, there's a part where somebody watched somebody else through a "*** in the wall." I remember we were reading that out loud in high school and the person who was reading it stopped right before saying it and looked around at the teacher, like, "Am I supposed to go ahead and read this?" So basically, either that was intentional, or ESPN copy editors are less culturally sensitive than 14 year old kids.
That guy ought to be fired.
